bioghist.p: Dr. Adalbert Riedl (1898-1978) was the longtime director of the Burgenland State Museum in Eisenstadt and the author of Lied-Flugblattdrucke aus dem Burgenland (Song Broadsides from the Burgenland).

scopecontent.p: The Riedl collection contains nearly 700 items, mostly prayers and songs in leaflet or chapbook form. The inclusion of a number of duplicates or slight variants brings the total number of pieces to about 800. The bulk of the collection appears to have been printed in the 19th century. There are a few pieces from the 18th century and a few from the 20th. Perhaps half of the pieces have no place, publisher, or date indicated. The collection is arranged into five series: prayers; religious songs; religious and secular songs and stories; a bound volume of religious songs; and holograph leaflets and chapbooks.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
